main event: A bright light was observed in the eastern sky near New Rochelle, New York on October 26, 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed by three civilian patrolmen in a patrol car.
The object moved slowly from east to west and disappeared over the horizon.
The object was described as a bright light, round in shape, not unlike a star or bright light.
No unusual features or details were noted about the object.
The investigating officer believes the object was likely the star Sirius, which had triggered several other UFO reports during that period.
sighted object: A bright light, round in shape
